Input.title: Input Parameters
Input.description: Mandatory Parameters to start the resquiggle analysis

basecalling.title: Run Basecalling
basecalling.description: Do you want to run basecalling + alignment?

bam_file.title: Input BAM file
bam_file.description: Path to input bam file. Bam files must be aligned to reference and contain move table and MD flags. You only need to provide a Bam file if Basecalling is not selected.

outdir.title: Save Path
outdir.description: This is the directory where the output gets saved

reference_fasta.title: Reference fasta file path
reference_fasta.description: File path to a fasta reference carrying a single transcript sequence.
reference_fasta.help_text: The analysis with Modidec is right now focussing on single transcript sequences only.

flowcell_type.title: Flowcell Type
flowcell_type.description: Select the RNA flowcell type you have generated your data with

curation_type.title: Curation type
curation_type.description: Select whether you want to use the output data for network training or for data analysis. If you use the Training option the files will be randomly separated into training and validation datasets.

mod_mapping.title: Modification Mapping
mod_mapping.description: Will create chunks around modification position

modified_data.title: Modified Data
modified_data.description: Do the reads contain modified bases or not?

mod_list.title: Modification Dictionary
mod_list.description: A dictionary defining all different types of modifications introduced during the training process, alternative basenames for modified bases with default: Gm, m6A, Ino, Psi

mod_type.title: Modification Types
mod_type.description: Choose a key according to the 'Modification dictionary' indicating your modification type. If you have several modifications you can use a space separated string (e.g. Gm Ino m6A).

mod_pos.title: Positions of interest
mod_pos.description: Positions of interest of which you want retrieve curated data. Use a space separated string to indicate several modifications are located on the template. (e.g. 92 93 94) These positions correspond to the order of modifications defined in 'Modification Type'.

Segmentation_Params.title: Segmentation Parameters
Segmentation_Params.description: Advanced parameters related to data segmentation

batch_size.title: Training entities saved per output file
batch_size.description: Number of training entities saved per file in .npz format.

start_read_num.title: Choose a start index for read selection
start_read_num.description: The start index can be used to control the read selection process.

end_read_num.title: Choose a stop index for read selection
end_read_num.description: The stop index can be used to control the read selection process.
